Package com.opengamma.strata.math.impl

Class FuzzyEquals

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.opengamma.strata.math.impl.FuzzyEquals
  • public class FuzzyEquals
extends java.lang.Object
    Tests for values being equal allowing for a level of floating point fuzz Based on the OG-Maths C++ fuzzy equals code.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      FuzzyEquals()  

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      static boolean ArrayFuzzyEquals​(double[][] arr1, double[][] arr2)
      Checks if two double precision floating point array of arrays are approximately "equal" Equal means the arrays have values the are considered fuzzy equals appearing in the same order and the arrays the same dimension.
      static boolean ArrayFuzzyEquals​(double[][] arr1, double[][] arr2, double maxabserror, double maxrelerror)
      Checks if two double precision floating point array of arrays are approximately "equal" Equal means the arrays have values the are considered fuzzy equals appearing in the same order and the arrays the same dimension.

      • SingleValueFuzzyEquals

        public static boolean SingleValueFuzzyEquals​(double val1,
                                             double val2,
                                             double maxabserror,
                                             double maxrelerror)
        Checks if two double precision floating point numbers are approximately "equal"
        Parameters:
        val1 - the first value
        val2 - the second value
        maxabserror - determines the minimum threshold for "equal" in terms of the two numbers being very small in magnitude.
        maxrelerror - determines the minimum threshold for "equal" in terms of the relative magnitude of the numbers. i.e. invariant of the magnitude of the numbers what is the maximum level of magnitude difference acceptable.
        Returns:
        true if they are considered equal, else false

      • SingleValueFuzzyEquals

        public static boolean SingleValueFuzzyEquals​(double val1,
                                             double val2)
        Checks if two double precision floating point numbers are approximately "equal" Default values are used for tolerances
        Parameters:
        val1 - the first value
        val2 - the second value
        Returns:
        true if they are considered equal, else false

      • ArrayFuzzyEquals

        public static boolean ArrayFuzzyEquals​(double[] arr1,
                                       double[] arr2,
                                       double maxabserror,
                                       double maxrelerror)
        Checks if two double precision floating point arrays are approximately "equal" Equal means the arrays have values the are considered fuzzy equals appearing in the same order and the arrays the same length.
        Parameters:
        arr1 - the first value
        arr2 - the second value
        maxabserror - determines the minimum threshold for "equal" in terms of the two numbers being very small in magnitude.
        maxrelerror - determines the minimum threshold for "equal" in terms of the relative magnitude of the numbers. i.e. invariant of the magnitude of the numbers what is the maximum level of magnitude difference acceptable.
        Returns:
        true if they are considered equal, else false
